alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Central Laramie County; Converse County Lower Elevations; East Laramie County; East Platte County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Goshen County; Laramie Valley; Niobrara County; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Hard Freeze Watch issued May 19 at 3:04AM MDT until May 21 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HARD FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 25 possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central, south central and southeast Wyoming and panhandle Nebraska. * WHEN...From Friday evening through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
